semantic_title: Other Types of Myocardial Infarction Classification and Coding Rules
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 9. Chapter 9: Diseases of the Circulatory System > e. Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) > 5. Other Types of Myocardial Infarction

content.full_text: The ICD-10-CM provides codes for different types of myocardial infarction. Type 1 myocardial infarctions are assigned to codes I21.0-I21.4. Type 2 myocardial infarction (myocardial infarction due to demand ischemia or secondary to ischemic imbalance) is assigned to code I21.A1, Myocardial infarction type 2 with the underlying cause coded first, if applicable. Do not assign code I24.89, Other forms of acute ischemic heart disease, for the demand ischemia. If a type 2 AMI is described as NSTEMI or STEMI, only assign code I21.A1. Codes I21.01-I21.4 should only be assigned for type 1 AMIs. Acute myocardial infarctions type 3, 4a, 4b, 4c and 5 are assigned to code I21.A9, Other myocardial infarction type. The 'Code also' and 'Code first' notes should be followed related to complications, and for coding of postprocedural myocardial infarctions during or following cardiac surgery. (Evidence: pg no: 55-56, L35-L43)
content.summary: Classification and coding rules for different types of myocardial infarction including type 1, type 2, and types 3-5 with specific code assignments and restrictions (Evidence: pg no: 55-56, L35-L43)
key_concepts: Type-specific AMI coding (Evidence: pg no: 55, L35-L36)
Type 2 AMI demand ischemia classification (Evidence: pg no: 55, L36-L37)
Underlying cause coding for type 2 AMI (Evidence: pg no: 55, L37-L38)
Types 3-5 AMI consolidated coding (Evidence: pg no: 55, L40)
Postprocedural AMI coding notes (Evidence: pg no: 55-56, L41-L43)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Type 1 myocardial infarctions are assigned to codes I21.0-I21.4 (Evidence: pg no: 55, L36)
detailed_rules.explanation: Traditional AMI types with specific anatomical site coding use the I21.0-I21.4 range (Evidence: pg no: 55, L36)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Type 2 myocardial infarction is assigned to code I21.A1 with underlying cause coded first if applicable (Evidence: pg no: 55, L37-L38)
detailed_rules.explanation: Type 2 AMI due to demand ischemia or ischemic imbalance requires specific coding with underlying cause identification (Evidence: pg no: 55, L36-L38)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If a type 2 AMI is described as NSTEMI or STEMI, only assign code I21.A1 (Evidence: pg no: 55, L39-L40)
detailed_rules.explanation: Type 2 AMI classification overrides STEMI/NSTEMI designation for coding purposes (Evidence: pg no: 55, L39-L40)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify AMI type from documentation
Step 2: Apply appropriate code range based on type
Step 3: For type 2, identify and code underlying cause first
Step 4: Follow 'Code also' and 'Code first' notes for complications

code_ranges.description: Type 1 myocardial infarctions (Evidence: pg no: 55, L36)
usage_rules: Should only be assigned for type 1 AMIs (Evidence: pg no: 55, L40)
Include site-specific STEMI and NSTEMI codes (Evidence: pg no: 55, L36)

specific_codes.description: Myocardial infarction type 2 (Evidence: pg no: 55, L37)
specific_codes.context: For demand ischemia or secondary to ischemic imbalance

specific_codes.description: Other myocardial infarction type (Evidence: pg no: 55, L40)
Other forms of acute ischemic heart disease (Evidence: pg no: 55, L38-L39)
specific_codes.context: Do not use for demand ischemia in type 2 AMI

code_patterns.description: Type 2 AMI coding pattern with underlying cause first (Evidence: pg no: 55, L37-L38)
code_patterns.example: A41.9 + I21.A1 for sepsis-induced type 2 AMI
code_patterns.explanation: Underlying cause should be coded first when applicable for type 2 AMI

references_to.title: Subsequent acute myocardial infarction
references_to.explanation: AMI type classification affects subsequent AMI coding rules

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient develops AMI secondary to septic shock
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Type 2 myocardial infarction due to septic shock from pneumonia
step_by_step: Step 4: Assign I21.A1 for type 2 AMI

correct_coding.sequencing: Underlying cause first, then type 2 AMI
correct_coding.rationale: Type 2 AMI requires underlying cause to be coded first when applicable (Evidence: pg no: 55, L37-L38)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Type 2 AMI should not use type 1 AMI codes
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using NSTEMI code instead of type 2 specific code

coding_scenarios.scenario: Type 2 AMI documented as STEMI pattern
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Type 2 STEMI secondary to severe anemia
step_by_step: Step 1: Recognize type 2 classification takes precedence
Step 2: Do not use STEMI-specific codes

correct_coding.rationale: Type 2 AMI uses only I21.A1 regardless of STEMI/NSTEMI description (Evidence: pg no: 55, L39-L40)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not use STEMI codes for type 2 AMI
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Adding STEMI code when type 2 is documented

procedure_links.context: Postprocedural AMI coding during or following cardiac surgery
procedure_links.note: Follow 'Code also' and 'Code first' notes for postprocedural AMI (Evidence: pg no: 55-56, L41-L43)

examples.scenario: Type 4a AMI related to PCI procedure

breakdown.I21: Acute myocardial infarction category (Evidence: pg no: 55, L40)
breakdown.A9: Other myocardial infarction types including type 4a (Evidence: pg no: 55, L40)

examples.rationale: Types 3, 4a, 4b, 4c, and 5 AMI all use code I21.A9 (Evidence: pg no: 55, L40)

warnings: Do not assign I24.89 for demand ischemia in type 2 AMI (Evidence: pg no: 55, L38-L39)
Codes I21.01-I21.4 should only be assigned for type 1 AMIs (Evidence: pg no: 55, L40)
Type 2 AMI described as STEMI/NSTEMI still uses only I21.A1 (Evidence: pg no: 55, L39-L40)
best_practices: Always identify AMI type before code selection (Evidence: pg no: 55, L35-L36)
Code underlying cause first for type 2 AMI when applicable (Evidence: pg no: 55, L37-L38)
Follow 'Code also' and 'Code first' notes for complications (Evidence: pg no: 55-56, L41-L43)
common_mistakes: Using type 1 codes for type 2 AMI (Evidence: pg no: 55, L39-L40)
Adding I24.89 for demand ischemia (Evidence: pg no: 55, L38-L39)
Using STEMI/NSTEMI codes with type 2 AMI (Evidence: pg no: 55, L39-L40)
tips: Type 2 AMI classification overrides STEMI/NSTEMI designation (Evidence: pg no: 55, L39-L40)
Types 3-5 AMI are consolidated under single code I21.A9 (Evidence: pg no: 55, L40)
implementation_notes: AMI type classification is critical for proper code selection
Underlying cause identification is important for type 2 AMI coding
clinical_context: Type 2 AMI results from supply-demand mismatch
Types 3-5 AMI have specific clinical definitions but shared coding
